results.title: Winter comes to the forest
results.brief_description: A study of the many ways that living things are adapted for living through the winter. The forest looks cold, bare, and dead, but a closer look reveals buds containing tiny leaves, the cocoon of a moth, a chickadee looking for insect eggs, rabbit tracks in the snow, and seeds that will grow next spring.

results.title: Winter at Mount Buffalo
results.brief_description: Holiday at Mount Buffalo, a skier’s paradise. Novices are taught how to ski and how not to ski. Demonstrations of herring bone and side stepping up steep slopes, balance and control for slalom beginners; the thrill of a snow-jump and an exhilarating 60 miles per hour run by experts.

results.title: Winter 1929: de Stadhuis-Brand te Leiden. Ijmuiden, 29 April 1930: wereld's grootste ships Geopend
results.brief_description: Winter 1929 - footage of firefighting, showing the use of heavy hosing. Water icing over in buildings in the middle of winter after putting fires out. Ijmuiden 29th April 1930 - footage of dams and huge water reservoir and steamship docking from the Netherlands with a caption about the “Johan Van Oldenbarmetelt” with the Kooninklijke family on board.

results.title: Winter's tale
results.creator_credit: BBC-TV, Jonathan Miller and Jane Howell
results.brief_description: One of Shakespeare’s later works, “Winter’s tale” was written in 1611. King Leontes of Sicilia suspects his wife of adultery with his friend the king of Bohemia. He orders that his new born daughter be left in a desolate place to die. The oracle of Apollo declares that Leontes will live without an heir and soon after his only son dies. The baby girl Perdita is found and raised by shepherds and grows to be loved by Florizel the son of the king of Bohemia. It is discovered that Perdita is the lost daughter of Leontes, and then he is happily reunited with his daughter, his wife Hermione, and his old friend the king of Bohemia. Produced by Jonathon Miller.

results.title: Winter
results.creator_credit: TV Ed Productions, Victoria. Ministry of Education, David Ferris and Jeff Spencer
results.brief_description: This program hosted by Trevor Lunn and Kevin Koala invite guests to explain just what is Winter and how does the season affect us and the plants and animals around us. These guests come from the Melbourne Museum Education Service, Royal Melbourne Zoo Education Service and the Victorian Schools Nursery.

results.title: Winter
results.brief_description: Animation about a snow covered mountain village threatened by a large menacing stranger. Normal village activities are stopped while the villagers band together to drive him away.

results.title: Winstanley. It happened here again
results.creator_credit: BFI, Kevin Brownlow and Andrew Mollo
results.brief_description: In the aftermath of the Civil Wars in 1649, a sect of impoverished men and women, known as the Diggers (or Levellers), formed a communal settlement in Surrey under the leadership of a revolutionary idealist, Gerrard Winstanley. They incurred the resentment of local people stirred up by the parson. On a budget of 30,000 pounds, the filmmakers show meticulous respect for history in pruning away the speculative aspects of the novel and scant regard for the conventions of historical drama on film in recreating the erosion of a dream. The tape also includes ‘It happened here again’, a 50 minute documentary on the making of the film. Cast includes Miles Halliwell, Jerome Willis, Terry Higgins and Phil Oliver. Adapted from the novel “Comrade Jacob” by David Caute and the writings of Gerrard Winstanley.

results.title: Winstanley
results.creator_credit: BFI, Kevin Brownlow and Andrew Mollo
results.brief_description:
In the aftermath of the Civil Wars in 1649, a sect of impoverished men and women, known as the Diggers (or Levellers) formed a communal settlement in Surrey under the leadership of a revolutionary idealist, Gerrard Winstanley. They incurred the resentment of local people stirred up by the parson. On a budget of 30,000 pounds the filmmakers show meticulous respect for history in pruning away the speculative aspects of the novel and scant regard for the conventions of historical drama on film in recreating the erosion of a dream. Also available on VHS and 16mm.

Credits: Producers, directors, Kevin Brownlow, Andrew Mollo photography, Ernest Vincze ; editing, Sarah Ellis.
Cast: Miles Halliwell ; Jerome Willis, Terry Higgins, Phil Oliver.
Note: Based on the novel ‘Comrade Jacob’ by David Caute.

results.title: Winslow boy [study extract]
results.creator_credit: London Film Productions, BFI and Anthony Asquith
results.brief_description: The early part of the trial scenes, the cross-examinations interspersed with shots of people buying newspapers, the family coping with reporters, etc. Particularly interesting as an example of the adaptation of a stage play to the cinema. Based on the play by Terence Rattigan. Cast includes Robert Donat, Margaret Leighton.

results.title: Winning public support
results.brief_description: Looks at the setting up a rapid transit system in San Francisco and the actions of the various county councils involved. Examines the roles of individuals within these organizations, their interactions and different levels of power, and influence in participating in this scheme.
